channel.title: Is Paypal Good to Use for Donations?
channel.description:
Hello,
Should I verify my Paypal to receive donations? Is Paypal worth it? I've heard pretty bad stories with people using Paypal, but I don't know an alternate and universal way to receive donations. If you guys know a safer, and equally or more effective way to set up a donating process, please share your opinions!
TheCyberMan
P.S. Are there other ways for people to verify their Paypal who don't want to give their bank account info and don't have a credit card?

item.title: Is Paypal Good to Use for Donations?
item.dc:creator: @Frell Frell
item.description:
@Frell wrote:

I get payed for graphic work all the time with paypal.

Read full topic

item.title: Is Paypal Good to Use for Donations?
item.dc:creator: @TheCyberMan TheCyberMan
item.description:
@TheCyberMan wrote:

[quote=“ollie123, post:20, topic:407337”][quote author=Pastebin]
Dear PayPal, its customers, and our friends around the globe,

This is an official communiqué from Anonymous and Lulz Security in the name of AntiSec.

In recent weeks, we’ve found ourselves outraged at the FBI’s willingness to arrest and threaten those who are involved in ethical, modern cyber operations. Law enforcement continues to push its ridiculous rules upon us - Anonymous “suspects” may face a fine of up to 500,000 USD with the addition of 15 years’ jailtime, all for taking part in a historical activist movement. Many of the already-apprehended Anons are being charged with taking part in DDoS attacks against corrupt and greedy organizations, such as PayPal.

What the FBI needs to learn is that there is a vast difference between adding one’s voice to a chorus and digital sit-in with Low Orbit Ion Cannon, and controlling a large botnet of infected computers. And yet both of these are punishable with exactly the same fine and sentence.

In addition to this horrific law enforcement incompetence, PayPal continues to withhold funds from WikiLeaks, a beacon of truth in these dark times. By simply standing up for ourselves and uniting the people, PayPal still sees it fit to wash its hands of any blame, and instead encourages and assists law enforcement to hunt down participants in the AntiSec movement.

Quite simply, we, the people, are disgusted with these injustices. We will not sit down and let ourselves be trampled upon by any corporation or government. We are not scared of you, and that is something for you to be scared of. We are not the terrorists here: you are.

We encourage anyone using PayPal to immediately close their accounts and consider an alternative. The first step to being truly free is not putting one’s trust into a company that freezes accounts when it feels like, or when it is pressured by the U.S. government. PayPal’s willingness to fold to legislation should be proof enough that they don’t deserve the customers they get. They do not deserve your business, and they do not deserve your respect.

Join us in our latest operation against PayPal - tweet pictures of your account closure, tell us on IRC, spread the word. Anonymous has become a powerful channel of information, and unlike the governments of the world, we are here to fight for you. Always.

Signed, your allies,

Lulz Security (unvanned)
Anonymous (unknown)
AntiSec (untouchable)
[/quote][/quote] That is some scary radicalism…

Read full topic
item.source: Is Paypal Good to Use for Donations?

item.title: Is Paypal Good to Use for Donations?
item.dc:creator: @the_elve_age the elve age
item.description:
@the_elve_age wrote:

I went ahead and took my bank account + my card info off of it.

Whats also bullshit is Paypals like “6 month security check” which makes you enter your bank number AGAIN after they already have it. Thats pretty unsafe.

Read full topic

item.dc:creator: @Kidpaparoach Kidpaparoach
item.description:
@Kidpaparoach wrote:

Eh Pretty Easy:

It is not fraud since you are merely using it as a safeguard to not let the money that has once come into your hands be taken away.

Its an opinion, it would be classified as fraud in the courts etc but in reality its not as what purpose your using it for.
So many things like this are fucked up:/.

item.title: Is Paypal Good to Use for Donations?
item.dc:creator: @Jamie1200 Jamie1200
item.description:
@Jamie1200 wrote:

[quote=“Eh Pretty Easy, post:14, topic:407337”]Protip: make a few separate PP accounts. Input your real information, such as bank account and debit card details whatnot if you intend to use it for online shopping and such. When someone wishes to make a donation, have them send the payment to one of your “fake” accounts, and after receiving the money immediately transfer it over to your real account. I also suggest deleting the fake account if you have no use for it, since if someone chargebacks, the account will get negative balance (not really a problem since you’re not using it).

OR: you could always use WU, although it is a bit of a hassle and I doubt most people who play on servers actually can be bothered to find a WU agent.[/quote]

That would be called fraud. That is illegal.

Read full topic
item.source: Is Paypal Good to Use for Donations?

item.title: Is Paypal Good to Use for Donations?
item.dc:creator: @Eh_Pretty_Easy Eh Pretty Easy
item.description:
@Eh_Pretty_Easy wrote:

Protip: make a few separate PP accounts. Input your real information, such as bank account and debit card details whatnot if you intend to use it for online shopping and such. When someone wishes to make a donation, have them send the payment to one of your “fake” accounts, and after receiving the money immediately transfer it over to your real account. I also suggest deleting the fake account if you have no use for it, since if someone chargebacks, the account will get negative balance (not really a problem since you’re not using it).

OR: you could always use WU, although it is a bit of a hassle and I doubt most people who play on servers actually can be bothered to find a WU agent.

Read full topic
item.source: Is Paypal Good to Use for Donations?

it goes on … aha

item.title: Is Paypal Good to Use for Donations?
item.dc:creator: @TheCyberMan TheCyberMan
item.description:
@TheCyberMan wrote:

Kidpaparoach:

Or get a prepaid card and they can send money to your prepaid card.

Can you actually do that? What card would you need and how would the process work? Lol, I’ve never heard of that before…

item.source: Is Paypal Good to Use for Donations?

item.title: Is Paypal Good to Use for Donations?
item.dc:creator: @Kidpaparoach Kidpaparoach
item.description:
@Kidpaparoach wrote:

No £200 chargeback ($320’ish).
Use western union, make a page on your website explaining what details to input and how to do so. Yes, it may not be as good but you know your money is safe.
Or get a prepaid card and they can send money to your prepaid card.

Read full topic
item.source: Is Paypal Good to Use for Donations?

item.title: Is Paypal Good to Use for Donations?
item.dc:creator: @Andrew_Ferguson The317Guy
item.description:
@Andrew_Ferguson wrote:

ollie123:

I would stay away from PayPal until this LulzSec thing clears up.

In all likenesses PayPal probably wont be around much longer, there becoming the MySpace of Payment sites, their stocks are dropping and multiple lawsuits are being pressed agents them. This is a good time to support the smaller sites and help them grow!

item.description:
@Andrew_Ferguson wrote:

Fridder:

^ Alertpay sounds a lot better… I’ve had over $120 taken back from the kids who quit, while they gave out all these items and ruined the small economy.

Plus they have live support for members with accounts older then a month old, paypal only has emails and they don’t even respond lol.

item.title: Is Paypal Good to Use for Donations?
item.dc:creator: @Andrew_Ferguson The317Guy
item.description:
@Andrew_Ferguson wrote:

No, no, no, no, a million times no and heres a few reasons.

  1. Paypal caves in to every little threat they get from anyone, your account could be closed and non of your money refunded just cause some random kid said you might have scammed $2 from him.
  2. At least 5 hacking clans are plotting to DDOS Paypal till they allow Wiki leeks to get funding from donations VIA their services.
  3. Random fee’s will pop up, last month I got a $20 fee on mine for not using my account for 6 weeks because apparently business level accounts must be used once a month.

In my opinion go with Alert pay. It’s cheep, they don’t steal your money, and your customers wont be able to screw you over by requesting their money back.

Read full topic
item.source: Is Paypal Good to Use for Donations?

The people who say bad stuff about Paypal are morons. Go ahead use it, It is completely safe. its Verisigned and has a High grade encryption.

This.
Paypal is not perfect though, but do have a lot of nice features and security, but it’s rare for one to have a problem with Paypal or at least me.
